DublinCoreElements.label: Contributor
DublinCoreElements.definition: An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource.
DublinCoreElements.comment: Examples include a person, an organization, or a service.

DublinCoreElements.label: Coverage
DublinCoreElements.definition: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource.
DublinCoreElements.comment: May be a named place, geographic coordinates, or time period.

DublinCoreElements.label: Creator
DublinCoreElements.definition: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.
DublinCoreElements.comment: Examples include a person, an organization, or a service.

DublinCoreElements.label: Date
DublinCoreElements.definition: A point or period of time associated with an event in the resource's lifecycle.
DublinCoreElements.comment: Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme like W3CDTF.

DublinCoreElements.label: Description
DublinCoreElements.comment: May include an abstract, table of contents, or graphical representation.

DublinCoreElements.label: Format
DublinCoreElements.definition: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.

DublinCoreElements.label: Identifier
DublinCoreElements.definition: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.
DublinCoreElements.comment: Should conform to a formal identification system.

DublinCoreElements.label: Publisher
DublinCoreElements.definition: An entity responsible for making the resource available.
DublinCoreElements.comment: Examples include a person, an organization, or a service.

DublinCoreElements.label: Relation
DublinCoreElements.comment: Identify the related resource using a formal identification system.

DublinCoreElements.label: Rights
DublinCoreElements.definition: Information about rights held in and over the resource.
DublinCoreElements.comment: Includes intellectual property rights and permissions.

DublinCoreElements.label: Source
DublinCoreElements.definition: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.
DublinCoreElements.comment: Identify the source using a formal identification system.

DublinCoreElements.label: Subject
DublinCoreElements.comment: Typically represented using keywords, key phrases, or classification codes.

DublinCoreElements.label: Title
DublinCoreElements.definition: A name given to the resource.
DublinCoreElements.comment: The name by which the resource is formally known.

DublinCoreElements.label: Type
DublinCoreElements.definition: The nature or genre of the resource.
DublinCoreElements.comment: Use controlled vocabularies like DCMI Type Vocabulary.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Collection
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: A collection is described as a group; its parts may also be separately described.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Dataset
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.definition: Data encoded in a defined structure.
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Examples include lists, tables, and databases. A dataset may be useful for direct machine processing.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Event
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Metadata for an event provides descriptive information that is the basis for discovery of the purpose, location, duration, and responsible agents associated with an event. Examples include webcasts, exhibitions, and conferences.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Image
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.definition: A visual representation other than text.
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Examples include paintings, drawings, graphic designs, plans, and photographs. Notable subtypes are 'MovingImage' and 'StillImage'.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Interactive Resource
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.definition: A resource requiring interaction from the user to be understood, executed, or experienced.
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Examples include forms on web pages, applets, multimedia learning objects, chat services, or virtual reality environments.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Moving Image
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.definition: A series of visual representations imparting an impression of motion when shown in succession.
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Examples include animations, movies, television programs, videos, or visual output from a simulation. Instances of 'MovingImage' are also instances of the broader 'Image' type.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Physical Object
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.definition: An inanimate, three-dimensional object or substance.
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Examples include artifacts, specimens, or furniture. Note that digital representations of physical objects are not instances of the 'PhysicalObject' type.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Service
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.definition: A system that provides one or more functions.
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Examples include a photocopying service, a banking service, an authentication service, or an interlibrary loan service.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Software
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.definition: A computer program in source or compiled form.
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Examples include application software, operating systems, or scripts. Note that software is distinct from data or documentation.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Sound
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.definition: A resource primarily intended to be heard.
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Examples include music files, audio compact discs, and recorded speeches.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Still Image
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Examples include paintings, drawings, graphic designs, plans, and photographs. Instances of 'StillImage' are also instances of the broader 'Image' type.

DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.label: Text
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.definition: A resource consisting primarily of words for reading.
DCMI_Type_Vocabulary.comment: Examples include books, articles, letters, and dissertations. Note that spoken word recordings are instances of the 'Sound' type.

W3C_DateTime.title: Date and Time Formats
W3C_DateTime.definition: A W3C profile of ISO 8601 that specifies a standard format for representing dates and times in Internet-related applications.

components.timezone: TZD (e.g., Z for UTC or +02:00 for a specific offset)

usage_notes: Dates should be in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Times should be in hh:mm:ss format using a 24-hour system.
Time zones should be indicated using UTC (Z) or a numeric offset (+hh:mm).
This format is widely used in web standards, metadata, and APIs.
